My Little Pony
Charlie Adler
4-Speed is one of the Big Brother ponies, who returned to Dream Valley after a year-long race around the world at the beginning of Somnambula. He is an expert driver.

Ace
Male
Orange
White
Blue
Soccer ball
My Little Pony Tales
Brad Swaile

Ace is very athletic and confident and also Teddy's best friend, who is often his partner in trouble in influencing Lancer. He is the handsome jock of the school, and a dream date for many of the girls. He is also a very sporty pony who enjoys soccer and many other activities, being the captain of the school's soccer team with Patch. He has an unrequited crush on Melody and later, at Starlight.

Amberlocks
Female
Pink
Yellow and orange
Blue
Purple band with blonde hair wrapped around it tied with blue ribbons
My Little Pony: Twinkle Wish Adventure
Anna Cummer

The owner of the Celebration Salon, Amberlocks is a stylish pony who helps her friends look prettier and fancier than ever. As she combs and styles their hair, she also helps them choose their best party outfits, and tells the latest stories. She appears in My Little Pony: Twinkle Wish Adventure as a background character.

Apple Bloom
Female
Yellow
Red
orange
Red, pink and purple shield with an apple and heart in the center
My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
Michelle Creber

Apple Bloom is a filly earth pony with a yellow body, orange eyes and a red mane and tail and she wears a large pink bow. She is the younger sister of Big McIntosh and Applejack and a member of the Apple Pony Family, Apple Bloom's worries over being one of the last ponies in her class without a cutie mark make her feel like an outcast until she meets two other "Blank Flanks" and befriends them. She has a thick Western American accent like Applejack, but it tends to fade when she talks to someone she does not like or wants to prove herself to. Together with Scootaloo and Sweetie Belle, she formed the Cutie Mark Crusaders so they can find their place in the world. Apple Bloom knows martial arts and is skilled at design and carpentry, as shown by the speed with which she renovated Applejack's old treehouse for the Crusaders' use.

My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic (FiM)

Ashleigh Ball (FiM and Equestria Girls)

Applejack is an earth pony mare with an orange body, bright green eyes and a yellow mane and tail and she wears a light brown cowboy hat. She is a member of the Apple Pony Family, who speaks with a Western American accent (most similar to that from the Missouri Ozarks). In the first original animated special, she is a silly pony, always knocking over fences and looking over her shoulder to see where she has been. She loves apples and is frequently found in the Apple Orchard. In her first appearance (Rescue from Midnight Castle), she was one of four ponies to be corrupted by Tirek's Rainbow of Darkness in order to pull his chariot. She was reverted to normal after Tirek was destroyed. Applejack is the only character in the whole toy line to retain her appearance throughout the different incarnations (excluding the third variation). She then appeared again in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic, using her updated original series appearance instead of the third incarnation appearance. Applejack is very dependable and down-to-earth, but also stubborn and a bit selfish. She wears a brown cowboy hat and is the only one of the six main characters who keeps her mane and tail tied back, instead of letting them fall loose. Applejack comes from a large family of ponies with apple-related names, spread all over Equestria, who oversee apple orchards and run a group of businesses to sell apples and products made from them. Applejack has demonstrated her strength and dexterity on many occasions, and she is also very skilled with a lasso. Applejack's elemental spirit is Honesty and her Power Pony form is Mistress Marevelous.

Applejack is the only character in the whole toy line to retain her appearance throughout the different incarnations (excluding the third variation). She then appeared again in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic, using her updated original series appearance instead of the third incarnation appearance. Applejack is very dependable and down-to-earth, but also stubborn and a bit selfish. She wears a brown cowboy hat and is the only one of the six main characters who keeps her mane and tail tied back, instead of letting them fall loose. Applejack comes from a large family of ponies with apple-related names, spread all over Equestria, who oversee apple orchards and run a group of businesses to sell apples and products made from them. Applejack has demonstrated her strength and dexterity on many occasions, and she is also very skilled with a lasso. Applejack's elemental spirit is Honesty and her Power Pony form is Mistress Marevelous.

Applejack is an earth pony mare with an orange body, bright green eyes and a yellow mane and tail and she wears a light brown cowboy hat. She is a member of the Apple Pony Family, who speaks with a Western American accent (most similar to that from the Missouri Ozarks). In the first original animated special, she is a silly pony, always knocking over fences and looking over her shoulder to see where she has been. She loves apples and is frequently found in the Apple Orchard. My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
Brynna Drummond

Babs Seed is Apple Bloom and Applejack's cousin from Manehatten, introduced in the third season of the series. She arrives at the Ponyville train station, where Apple Bloom introduces her to the other Cutie Mark Crusaders, who then show her the clubhouse and their giant pumpkin float for the Float Parade. Diamond Tiara and Silver Spoon arrive shortly after and berate Babs for not having a cutie mark, which she seems self-conscious about. Ultimately, Babs makes fun of the Cutie Mark Crusaders, wrecks their float, and joins Diamond Tiara and Silver Spoon, Diamond Tiara commending Babs' "big city attitude". She then spends much of her time tormenting the Crusaders, who are scared of being "snitches" if they tell Applejack, and she even kicks them out of their clubhouse, forcing them to resort to drastic measures: booby-trapping a float and enticing her to ride it herself in an attempt to ultimately humiliate her. She is also the younger sister of Sunflower.However, on the day of the parade, the girls find out from Applejack that Babs was bullied and harassed in Manehatten, which is why Babs herself turned to bullying. After Babs is rescued from the sabotaged float, the four make amends, and Babs joins the Cutie Mark Crusaders, becoming the official fourth member and promising to start the Manehatten branch of the club. At the train station, she tells Applejack that she will tell her older sister about her being bullied when she gets back to Manehatten. Right before she returns home, she stands up to Diamond Tiara and Silver Spoon when they start teasing the Crusaders again and manages to effectively subdue them.

Baby Fifi is one of the first tooth ponies, in charge of taking care of the twins Baby Snookums and Sniffles and Baby Milkweed and Tumbleweed. Unlike her mother, who was a Unicorn, Baby Fifi is born as an Earth Pony and speaks with a French accent. Alongside the other baby ponies, she has one tooth and they were involved in a feud against Fudgey McSwain and Rocky Ripple.

My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic

Big McIntosh is the older brother of Applejack and Apple Bloom and a member of the Apple Pony Family, always seen wearing a hitching collar and chewing on a stalk of wheat. He has a calm and easy-going demeanor in contrast with his sister Applejack's more stubborn and energetic attitude. His appearance matches his demeanor: his eyes are generally half closed and he stoically accepts whatever's happening around him. He resembles a Clydesdale horse, as do most of the male ponies, but is considerably larger than the others.

Bon Bon is one of Starlight's friends, who is extremely fond of food and cooking. She dreams of becoming a fashion model and loves to write in her diary, detailing every day's events. Her family is quite large, consisting of four younger siblings (Amber, Twink, Rusty, a 'baby brother' and an unknown sibling), one older sister (Misty), and her parents. She then appears as a background pony in Friendship Is Magic. Sweetie Drops was released as one of Wave 7 blind bags in 2013. The card included in the package gives the character's personality that she "knows sharing treats makes them taste sweeter".One of the background earth pony mare characters in Friendship Is Magic shares color scheme and cutie mark with this character. Being a background pony, she has a different tone in her voice in each of her speaking roles.Bon Bon also appears in Rainbow Rocks as a competitor in the Battle of the Bands, together with Lyra Heartstrings. And from the episode "Slice of Life", she is revealed to be a secret agent.

Bow Tie currently holds the record on having the most variants of her ever created and released in each part of the world. She is described to be an earth pony in the special and is also involved during Scorpan's raid in Dream Valley. Bow Tie appeared again in the third toyline as one of the Dazzle Bright Ponies and then in the second of the 2000 animated specials, Dancing in the Clouds. She is one of Twinkle Twirl's students and loves to dance but always bumps into other ponies due to her clumsiness.

Bow Tie appeared again in the third toyline as one of the Dazzle Bright Ponies and then in the second of the 2000 animated specials, Dancing in the Clouds. She is one of Twinkle Twirl's students and loves to dance but always bumps into other ponies due to her clumsiness.

My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic

Braeburn is another member of the Apple Pony Family, who wears a brown cowboy hat and vest. He debuted in the 21st episode of My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic. Braeburn is Applejack, Big McIntosh and Apple Bloom's cousin from Appleloosa. He has a high opinion of the place and loves to give tours to visitors (whether they want one or not).

My Little Pony Tales
Laura Harris

Bright Eyes is the smart-aleck of Starlight's group. She was first seen as a Twinkle Eyed Earth Pony in 1986, also featuring as part of the "7 Pony Friends" in 1992, both from the original series or "G1" Line. An intelligent pony, Bright Eyes is quick to think things out logically when there's a problem. She loves to learn new things, and wishes to be an environmentalist when she grows up. She also has an infatuation with Lancer. Although her family never appears, it is mentioned that her father works for the paper.

Bubbles is a shy pony who loves to play in the muddy field and roll about covering herself in goo. But bath time is also a favorite time as she chases bubbles on the wind. In Rescue from Midnight Castle, she was one of four ponies to be corrupted by Tirek's Rainbow of Darkness in order to pull his chariot. She was reverted to normal after Tirek was destroyed.

My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic

Brian Drummond (S1E26)
Peter New (S2E15)

Caramel is a background pony who always appears in My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic. He is shown to be forgetful, managing to lose his grass seeds for Winter Wrap Up more than once according to Big McIntosh. His goof frustrates Applejack and only adds to the backlog of work to get through during the wrap up. He is one of two ponies in The Best Night Ever who pull the seven leading characters' carriage to the Grand Galloping Gala, the other being Lucky Clover. He is happy to pull the carriage for Rarity, but when Spike whips him with the strap, he shows a great deal of annoyance, shared by Lucky Clover. At this point, he also mentions that he is Rarity's neighbor. In Hearts and Hooves Day he is considered a suitable candidate for Cheerilee's date by Sweetie Belle until the "camera" pans to the left and reveals him rubbing noses with Wind Whistler. This causes Scootaloo to sarcastically remark that "his girlfriend sure thinks" he's acceptable. The male doctor in Read It and Weep shares Caramel's mane, coat, eye and tail color, but is a unicorn instead of an earth pony and has a heart monitor cutie mark instead of three horseshoes. He also has a different voice than that of Caramel in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000. In A Canterlot Wedding Part 2, Caramel serves as one of Shining Armor's aides-de-camp at his wedding to Princess Cadance.

In Hearts and Hooves Day he is considered a suitable candidate for Cheerilee's date by Sweetie Belle until the "camera" pans to the left and reveals him rubbing noses with Wind Whistler. This causes Scootaloo to sarcastically remark that "his girlfriend sure thinks" he's acceptable. The male doctor in Read It and Weep shares Caramel's mane, coat, eye and tail color, but is a unicorn instead of an earth pony and has a heart monitor cutie mark instead of three horseshoes. He also has a different voice than that of Caramel in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000. In A Canterlot Wedding Part 2, Caramel serves as one of Shining Armor's aides-de-camp at his wedding to Princess Cadance.

Caramel is a background pony who always appears in My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic. He is shown to be forgetful, managing to lose his grass seeds for Winter Wrap Up more than once according to Big McIntosh. His goof frustrates Applejack and only adds to the backlog of work to get through during the wrap up. He is one of two ponies in The Best Night Ever who pull the seven leading characters' carriage to the Grand Galloping Gala, the other being Lucky Clover. He is happy to pull the carriage for Rarity, but when Spike whips him with the strap, he shows a great deal of annoyance, shared by Lucky Clover. At this point, he also mentions that he is Rarity's neighbor. In Hearts and Hooves Day he is considered a suitable candidate for Cheerilee's date by Sweetie Belle until the "camera" pans to the left and reveals him rubbing noses with Wind Whistler. This causes Scootaloo to sarcastically remark that "his girlfriend sure thinks" he's acceptable. He also has a different voice than that of Caramel in The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000. Cheerilee was a Unicorn in My Little Pony Crystal Princess: The Runaway Rainbow. She acted as Rarity's teacher and adviser. Cheerilee, Brights Brightly, Whistle Wishes and Rarity were in charge of bringing in the first rainbow of the season until Rarity disappeared, and the remaining three ventured outside Unicornia to search for her. In the Core 7 series, Cheerilee became an Earth Pony and wore pigtails, both in the animation and in some of the merchandise. She loved flowers and enjoyed telling amazing stories. She is Scootaloo's older sister. As a baby, she wears a green bow on her head. In the Friendship is Magic series, her body has a slightly more purple hue and her symbol is now three smiling daisies. She also speaks with a womanly voice which is older than her little girl voice. She is the teacher in Apple Bloom's school and cares about each of her pony students, and loves to help them learn and grow. She seems to take a special interest in the Cutie Mark Crusaders, focusing on discovering their true talents.

Cherries Jubilee is an earth pony and the keeper of the Paradise Estate's orchards. She has a mature attitude and is sometimes a bit strict to some ponies. She re-appeared in My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic under the name Cherry Jubilee, the boss of Cherry Hill Ranch in Dodge Junction. Twilight Sparkle, Pinkie Pie, Rarity, Rainbow Dash, and Fluttershy all ran into Jubilee who told the five that working for the Cherry Hill Ranch would be a nice change for Applejack. She was last seen leaving the Ranch while allowing the five to help Applejack with the factory.

Cheval is Meadowlark's Husband and Clover's brother-in-law, who speaks with a French accent and is skilled in ballet. He also knows Clover's sister Meadowlark in the entertainment business and asked her hoof in marriage before the episode "Sister of the Bride". He and Meadowlark got married, making Cheval not just Meadowlark's husband, but also Clover's brother-in-law.

Clever Clover is an earth pony, first released in 1997 as one of the second incarnation Secret Surprise Friends and is one of the few male ponies released during the second incarnation toyline. He is described as an athlete, who likes to play all kinds of sports. Usually he wears his lucky baseball cap. Clever Clover appeared again in My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic as Clover the Clever, one of the characters in the Hearth's Warming Eve play. She was portrayed by Twilight Sparkle and is the protege' of Star Swirl the Bearded.

Clever Clover appeared again in My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic as Clover the Clever, one of the characters in the Hearth's Warming Eve play. She was portrayed by Twilight Sparkle and is the protege' of Star Swirl the Bearded.

My Little Pony Tales
Lalainia Lindbjerg

Clover Bloom (also known as Clover) is the klutziest member of Starlight's group. Clover is tremendously clumsy and prone to breaking things, sometimes bursting into tears in dismay at her own ineptitude. Nevertheless, things generally work out for her in the end, as a result of either luck or the intervention of her friends. A very superstitious pony, she can be quite gullible. Her father is a conceptual artist who makes sculptures out of scrap metal and other discarded items. She dreams of being a ballerina, like her big sister.

Laura Dean (Original TV Series)

Kelly Sheridan (Third Incarnation)

Cotton Candy is a sweet-lover, who loves sweet things: sweet nectar from the flowers, sweet honey from the bees, and sweet grass from the valley. However, she is also a bit lazy and tries to find her treats a little too close to home. Blossom's flower garden is always a tempting place to grab a snack. In Rescue from Midnight Castle, she was one of four ponies to be corrupted by Tirek's Rainbow of Darkness in order to pull his chariot. She was reverted to normal after Tirek was destroyed. Her daughter is Baby Cotton Candy. She was again re-released as part of the third incarnation toyline, with a significantly altered appearance. Cotton Candy runs the Cotton Candy Cafe where she serves ice cream and sundaes to her friends. She is also a storyteller, enjoying conversation.

Countess Coloratura (whose real name is Rara) is Applejack's old friend. According to Applejack, Rara first met her when they were fillies and they had fun at camp. She changed her style years later of becoming a well known pop singer and has been pampered by her own manager Svengallop who doesn't care much about the charity of the school foals as she does.

Diamond Tiara is an earth pony with a light magenta body, azure-blue eyes and a lilac mane and tail with a white streak. She is a school student, like Silver Spoon, is a bully who calls ponies without cutie marks "blank flanks" and deems them not special. She has a snooty personality and enjoys belittling others. Her behavior has changed as revealed in "Crusaders of the Lost Mark" when she decides to repair the school playground by donating her father's money.

Fiesta Flair is an earth pony who was never actually produced as a toy. Many speculate that due to her Mexican accent, name and symbol there might have been backlash that caused Hasbro to rethink her development. In the special, she is actually part of Pinkie Pie's musical band, suggesting her to use her Pinkie Squink to solve their problem on playing together. She then later appeared in My Little Pony: Twinkle Wish Adventure as a background character.

Filthy Rich
Male
Grayish Amber
Dark Gray with lighter highlights
Blue
Three bags of money
My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
Brian Drummond

Filthy Rich is an Earth pony and Diamond Tiara's father. He is introduced in the episode Family Appreciation Day. His name is based on the phrase filthy rich, referring to someone very wealthy. According to Granny Smith's tale in Family Appreciation Day, his grandfather, Stinkin' Rich, was one of the first ponies to buy Granny Smith's zap apple jam, and started a business by reselling them. In the same episode, it was told that this had helped contribute to the foundation of Ponyville. In the same episode, Filthy Rich appears on Sweet Apple Acres to politely confirm he will receive the first one hundred jars of zap apple jam from Granny Smith, "as usual". He is later seen giving a presentation about "Rich's Barnyard Bargains" to Apple Bloom's class that bores most of the class to sleep except for Twist and Diamond Tiara. He is again seen at the end of the episode pushing a reluctant Diamond Tiara to Sweet Apple Acres to help other fillies sing to the watering cans, part of the town elder's special process of making zap apple jam. Despite being a rich business pony and his daughter's mean spirit, Filthy is amicable to Apple Bloom, Granny Smith and everyone else. When Granny Smith calls him by his first name, he explains that he prefers "Rich". Cheerilee initially calls him "Mr. Filthy"; after he looks chidingly at her she immediately corrects herself, and he regains his usual easy going and calm appearance.

He is again seen at the end of the episode pushing a reluctant Diamond Tiara to Sweet Apple Acres to help other fillies sing to the watering cans, part of the town elder's special process of making zap apple jam. Despite being a rich business pony and his daughter's mean spirit, Filthy is amicable to Apple Bloom, Granny Smith and everyone else. When Granny Smith calls him by his first name, he explains that he prefers "Rich". Cheerilee initially calls him "Mr. Filthy"; after he looks chidingly at her she immediately corrects herself, and he regains his usual easy going and calm appearance.

Golden Harvest (nicknamed "Carrot Top") is an earth pony who appeared in many episodes, and had minor speaking roles. She has a moss-green mane in Boast Busters, contrary to her usual orange mane in all other appearances. Her name is not mentioned on the show, but it appears on the pamphlet of a surprise bag toy released in late October 2011. A trading card released in mid-2012 mentions that she earned the nickname "Carrot Top". Prior to this, an animator working on the show noted that, coincidentally, he had given the pony the same name as some of the fans, "Carrot Top".

The Headless Horse is first mentioned by Twilight Sparkle, in Look Before You Sleep. However, it only appeared in Sleepless In Ponyville in one of Scootaloo's dreams. Suddenly, before Scootaloo's eyes, it evaporates as Princess Luna's face appears in the moon. She tells Scootaloo, she's the dream master and that everypony has fears, everypony must face them in their own way. Then, Luna tells her to face her fears. Twilight Sparkle tells Applejack and Rarity "The Legend of the Headless Horse", while Rainbow Dash tells the cutie mark crusaders another story of the headless horse. She makes a Headless Horse shadow to go with the story.

Heart Bright is one of the two protagonist of Storybelle's story Two for the Sky. She alongside Star Flight both think alike like twins: playing together, eating sundaes together and wished that they can gain wings so they can fly to the sky, but most of all, they love to speak in rhyme. Strangely, she is listed as a Pegasus Pony in her toy incarnation.

My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic

Hoity Toity is a major representative of the fashion world from Canterlot, and arrived in Ponyville to see Rarity's fashion show. Having seen her "perfect" dresses, he then gave her a brutally honest review, saying how terrible they were. This almost ended the unicorn's career, until her friends brought him back to give Rarity another chance. He was impressed by the first set of her dresses, which she had set aside when her friends seemed dissatisfied with them, and decided to feature them at his boutique in Canterlot. He bears visual similarity to fashion designer Karl Lagerfeld, who carries a paper fan.

My Little Pony (TV series)
Paco Shakespeare

Knight Shade is an earth pony and a rock and roll star who performs from town to town alongside his band, the Shadowettes. Beneath the success, however, he is a troubled pony. His manager Zeb works for Arabus, a creature that looks like a storm cloud, who gives Knight Shade orders to steal shadows that he uses for energy. Knight Shade recounts how Zeb acquires the shadows and keeps them in his satchel, as well as anecdotes from life as a struggling singer on his hometown of Bright Valley. Arabus promised him fame but for a price—the theft of everyone's shadows, including his own mother's. Knight Shade tried to back out of the deal, but was forced to stay with Arabus for fear that his shadow would be taken too; something which would mean the end of his career and no chance of restoring his home. The ponies helped him to redeem himself and expose Zeb and Arabus's evil doings, and get everyone's shadows back.

His manager Zeb works for Arabus, a creature that looks like a storm cloud, who gives Knight Shade orders to steal shadows that he uses for energy. Knight Shade recounts how Zeb acquires the shadows and keeps them in his satchel, as well as anecdotes from life as a struggling singer on his hometown of Bright Valley. Arabus promised him fame but for a price—the theft of everyone's shadows, including his own mother's. Knight Shade tried to back out of the deal, but was forced to stay with Arabus for fear that his shadow would be taken too; something which would mean the end of his career and no chance of restoring his home. The ponies helped him to redeem himself and expose Zeb and Arabus's evil doings, and get everyone's shadows back.

Lancer is one of Ace's friends, and is described as the quietest of the male ponies. Lancer is shy and fond of books and his parents are very wealthy and often away on trips. Lancer seems to have feelings for Bright Eyes, and is shown to be talented at roller skating. He wants to be an explorer when he grows up. He is much softer than the other boys and often takes side with the girls, much of the time to impress Bright Eyes.

Lickety-Split is an abrasive cynic Earth Pony with an ice cream addiction. Lickety-Split enjoys planning surprise birthday parties for her friends and makes sure there's lots of delicious ice cream to accompany the cake. Whenever a pony is feeling sad, Lickety-Split will cheer her up with one of her special ice cream creations. She has a daughter named Baby Lickety-Split. She alongside the other baby ponies has one tooth and was involved in a feud against Fudgey McSwain and Rocky Ripple. In the Movie Baby Lickety-split has no first tooth, and some other episodes. Lickety-Split re-appeared as a male Earth Pony in My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic, in which he gave his ball to Spike.

Meadowlark Bloom (Also named Meadowlark) is Clover's older sister and Cheval's wife. Meadowlark herself is a supportive and patient sister to her woefully clumsy younger sister even through all the fame she has. She is also a ballerina and once a clumsy one like Clover until she improved. Cheval knows her in the entertainment business and asked her hoof in marriage before the episode "Sister of the Bride". Later on, both of them got married and became Cheval's wife.

Maud Pie is Pinkie's sister who is first seen as a filly in a picture on the episode called "Pinkie Pride". She physically appears in the episode named after her as a mature pony wearing a blue dress with a black belt. She's not excited as Pinkie highly is, but they have the same heart.Maud Pie also appears in Rainbow Rocks during the pajama party held by Pinkie and the over five main characters.

Mayor Mare is an earth pony who wears half-moon glasses and a white shirt collar secured with a green ribbon tie. As the pony in charge of the Ponyville community, her main task is overseeing the town, especially during important events. While a serene individual, she tends to become stressed when something goes wrong, particularly when the community fails to get along or when certain major tasks are not finished on time.

Melody is the lead singer of "The Rockin' Beats" and one of Starlight's friends. She is shallow, gossipy, and rather spoiled, holding her own interests higher than those of her friends. She sometimes tries to offer beauty advice to the others, and hopes to become a famous rock star. She has two young twin sisters named Jing-A-Ling and Ting-A-Ling, and her mother is a nurse. The second incarnation of Melody was released in 2002.

Merriweather is an earth pony first released in 1987 as a Twice as Fancy Pony in the Original Series Line. Merriweather herself likes to go on summer picnics with her frienbds and skip to a field of soft grass. She is again released in 2004 as a Sparkle Pony. She loves the sunny days, and likes to play with Star Flight and Heart Bright.

Minty is one of the original My Little Pony Characters released who had several variations throughout the different incarnations. She was first released in 1982 in the first original line of ponies and then re-released later in the year with concave bottom hooves and a slight pose alteration. Unlike Cotton Candy, she never did appear in the original television series. Minty was first released in 2003. She was a Glitter Celebration Pony and one of the original ponies on the re-launch of the My Little Pony toy line and became one of the main characters on several 2000 animated My Little Pony Specials. Minty is described to be a clumsy but airheaded ditz and also a green machine, who likes anything green, meaning it is her favorite color. She also loves collecting socks, standing on her head, playing checkers with Sweetberry and her favorite holiday is Christmas. There is an FiM minty as a blind bag, and a prototype Minty as a Playful Pony. She is expected to come out, and not remain as a prototype.

Miss Hackney is the ponies' homeroom teacher. She has quite a lot of patience, having to deal with Patch's immaturity on a daily basis. Very wise, she is a good role model and is strict but fair. Starlight looks up to her as her personal adviser and is suggested that she may have feelings for Mr. Kiddoo.

Mother Pie is Pinkie Pie's only mother in the Core 7 side spinoff "Once Upon a My Little Pony Time". She debuted in 2009 alongside the Family Convertible with Newborn Pinkie Pie. Mr. Carrot Cake and Mrs. Cup Cake are the owners of Sugarcube Corner and Pinkie Pie's employers and landlords, as they rent the loft above the shop to her. Their full names are first mentioned in the season 2 episode "Baby Cakes". The couple frequently perform catering services in Ponyville, specializing in sweets and baked goods. They are shown preparing many cakes and sweets for Princess Celestia's visit in Swarm of the Century, and wait on the Princess at the party thrown for her in A Bird in the Hoof. As seen in the first episode, Sweet Apple Acres also caters food for events, in this case the Summer Sun Celebration, meaning the Cakes are not without competition in Ponyville. They prepare a special sapphire cupcake for Spike for his birthday in Secret of My Excess. Pinkie Pie works for them in their shop, and the Cakes show a good amount of patience for the party-loving pony, especially when she eats the merchandise or uses their shop floor as a party location. The Cakes become parents to twin toddlers, Pound Cake and Pumpkin Cake.

Ms. Peachbottom is one of the ponies with speckles on her face. She has been welcomed to the Crystal Empire by Twilight Sparkle and all of her friends and to entertain her, even without Rarity who is working on manicuring Princess Cadance, Twilight, Pinkie Pie, Fluttershy, Applejack and Rainbow Dash perform the Crystal Empire Cheer in complete perfection. Although Peachbottom is amused, she gets dizzy for looking up which forces her to exercise all her legs by galloping.

Octavia is an Earth pony who appears in some episodes of My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic as a background character. She plays a cello as part of a four-pony musical ensemble at the Grand Galloping Gala in the episode The Best Night Ever. She retains an apparent calm, dignified expression when in costume; except when Pinkie Pie disturbs her. At Pinkie's request, the orchestra plays the Pony Pokey. Octavia eventually falls over when Pinkie tries to make her play faster. Octavia appears briefly in Sweet and Elite in the garden party scene, playing with a different musical ensemble. William Anderson, the show's composer, has relayed to Equestria Daily that the music playing in the scene features a harp, two violins, and a cello, which pegs Octavia as a cellist. The show's director, Jayson Thiessen, figures the instrument is a cello as it is "more sophisticated and appropriate for the gala".In Rainbow Rocks, Octavia plays her cello in the Battle of the Bands, but she is defeated by the Rainbooms.

The Olden Pony is a myth told by Rainbow Dash in "Sleepless In Ponyville". She only appeared in two of Scootaloo's dreams, saying "Who's got my rusty horseshoe?!" In Scootaloo's last nightmare, Rainbow Dash is holding the Olden Pony's rusty horseshoe, and saying "Here it is, for pony's sake. Now, take it and stop all your moaning."

Patch is the adventurous tomboy of Starlight's group. Patch was adopted by her parents and is an only child. An active member of the soccer team, she is always on the lookout for something to do, and is fond of practical jokes. Patch seems to be the only pony who sees unnatural phenomenon around her like the Squire's ghost and the Glow n' Show Ponies. She wants to join the circus when she grows up.

Photo Finish is a famous fashion photographer in Equestria hailing from Canterlot. With her pseudo-German accent, Photo Finish joins the ranks of unplacable foreign-accent ponies. She is quite posh, stuck up, and dismissive of ponies she deems unworthy of her time. She travels with an entourage of servile ponies who never speak and who cater to her every whim, doing things like carrying her around and vanishing the moment she tells them to leave. She is a shameless self-promoter, always referring to herself as "I, Photo Finish." She is never seen without her sunglasses on and her eye color is unknown. She is a reference to Anna Wintour, the editor-in-chief of the fashion and lifestyle magazine Vogue. Her hairstyle and outfit also bear a resemblance to Lady Gaga.Photo Finish appears in Equestria Girls and Rainbow Rocks as the high school's school photographer and a competitor in the Battle of the Bands.

Pick-a-Lilly is an Earth Pony who is released alongside Sunny Salsa as a Super Long Haired Pony in 2005. She likes to dress up in pretty skirts and capes. In her motto, she says no outfit is complete with a pretty flower she wears behind her ear. She was re-released in Friendship is Magic as a unicorn, under the name Pick-a-Lily.

Pinkie Pie (full name Pinkamena Diane Pie) is a happy earth pony with a light pink body, light blue eyes and a magenta-pink mane and tail. who loves planning big parties and anything pink. She was also a natural leader in the Core 7 Series always ready to help her friends and share true friendship with them. In My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic, she is a party planner, very funny, talkative, and a bit air-headed. She also enjoys singing and playing pranks, sometimes with Rainbow Dash's help, but - showing her considerate side - will not play any on Fluttershy due to that pony's sensitive nature. In the episode called "Swarm of the Century", she makes a musician out of herself regardless of some other ponies' concerns about the Parasprites. Her behavior is frequently random and chaotic at times and she has been known to break the fourth wall. There is seldom a day without Pinkie's smile. She possesses the "Pinkie sense," an ability to predict events in the immediate future through twitches of various body parts including her mane and tail which can also have a gripping ability. When she becomes sad enough, her mane and tail go from curly to completely straight and her pink coloration loses its brightness, matching her appearance during her unhappy youth on a rock farm before she earned her cutie mark. While she usually hops around, Pinkie is exceptionally quick when running, able to keep pace with and chase down a hurrying, airborne Rainbow Dash. Pinkie Pie's elemental spirit is Laughter and her Power Pony form is Filli-Second.

She possesses the "Pinkie sense," an ability to predict events in the immediate future through twitches of various body parts including her mane and tail which can also have a gripping ability. When she becomes sad enough, her mane and tail go from curly to completely straight and her pink coloration loses its brightness, matching her appearance during her unhappy youth on a rock farm before she earned her cutie mark. While she usually hops around, Pinkie is exceptionally quick when running, able to keep pace with and chase down a hurrying, airborne Rainbow Dash. Pinkie Pie's elemental spirit is Laughter and her Power Pony form is Filli-Second.

Pinkie Pie (full name Pinkamena Diane Pie) is a happy earth pony with a light pink body, light blue eyes and a magenta-pink mane and tail. who loves planning big parties and anything pink. She was also a natural leader in the Core 7 Series always ready to help her friends and share true friendship with them. In My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic, she is a party planner, very funny, talkative, and a bit air-headed. She also enjoys singing and playing pranks, sometimes with Rainbow Dash's help, but - showing her considerate side - will not play any on Fluttershy due to that pony's sensitive nature. My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic
William Lawrenson

Pipsqueak (also known as "Pip") is a young earth pony foal who recently moved to Ponyville from Trottingham. He first appeared trick-or-treating with a group of fillies, at Twilight's Library, wearing a pirate costume, and he tells Twilight it is his first Nightmare Night ever. When talking to Twilight, he uses a British accent, but drops it later in the episode. He joins a group of fillies chaperoned by Pinkie Pie, which follows Zecora while she tells the story of Night Mare Moon. When Princess Luna appears, he gets scared and dumps his candy in front of Night Mare Moon's statue along with the rest of the group and they all run off. The other time he is shown is when Princess Luna saves him when he falls into Applejack's water apple barrel. He is startled when Pinkie Pie said she'll eat him and eventually runs off again. Later, he witnesses Princess Luna trying to scare the ponies and says that she is his favorite princess. As his name suggests, Pipsqueak is smaller than the other ponies. His light-colored coat has patches of color on it, unlike most ponies in the show who have a solid-color coat (a pattern called "paint" or "pinto" in real horses).

Posey is the gardener of Paradise Estates. Posey is very motherly to all the baby ponies and tends to the Paradise Estate's garden. She loves flowers and other pretty things and is always willing to help those in need. According to Lauren Faust, Posey is the inspiration for the Friendship is Magic incarnation of Fluttershy.

One of the six Princess Ponies, Princess Primrose is keeper of one of the Magic Wands which maintains the balance of Ponyland's magic, until it was stolen by Lavan, the Lava Demon. She usually has feuds with the other Princess Ponies on who should be queen, until they settle their differences and work together. Princess Primrose's wand allows her to manipulate the wind in any way she wishes.

Sapphire Shores is a famous popstar in Canterlot. She debuted back in third incarnation toyline as one of the Jewel Ponies, released in 2004. She loves to laugh and chat, but she enjoys quiet times. Sapphire also loves the beach and loves to walk along with her friends, listening to the sea. She appears again in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic in the Episode "A Dog and Pony Show". In the new series, her body color is changed to yellow and she now wears stylish clothes. She speaks with a loud and theatrical voice, frequently inserts musical intonations into her sentences. Despite her fame and over-the-top mannerisms, she seems to be quite friendly and approachable toward Rarity: she visits Rarity's shop personally and asks to be called by her first name.

In the new series, her body color is changed to yellow and she now wears stylish clothes. She speaks with a loud and theatrical voice, frequently inserts musical intonations into her sentences. Despite her fame and over-the-top mannerisms, she seems to be quite friendly and approachable toward Rarity: she visits Rarity's shop personally and asks to be called by her first name.

Starlight is the most mature and responsible of her group, dreaming of becoming a teacher and holds Miss Hackney in high regard. She is the leader, and others look to her for support. Star Swirl started out as a toy in original series as one of the Colorswirl Ponies. According to their Backcard story called "A Rainbow of Fun", The Colorswirl set out one day to discover where the rainbow gets its colors. The three friends pranced up one end of the rainbow and followed the stripes to the other end, where they found a magical lake swirling with colors. Hot and tired from walking, the ponies dove into the beautiful water for a refreshing swim. When they came out of the lake, their bodies were covered with bright, bold streaks! Not only did they find where the rainbow's colors came from, but they also went away with pretty swirls of their very own! In the second incarnation, Star Swirl is made into one of the Magician Ponies. In the third incarnation toyline, Star Swirl is an earth pony who loves to watch the night sky and look at the rainbow stars to make a wish. Also, she likes to look at the planets through a telescope every night. She was re-released in Friendship is Magic, bundled with the European Release of Rarity's Royal Gem Carriage using her new appearance. A male version of Star Swirl was then mentioned by Twilight Sparkle, who bases her costume on his appearance My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic during Nightmare Night. In the animation, Twilight Sparkle refers to Star Swirl as a male and calls him Star Swirl the Bearded (Also pressingly making him a unicorn in the animation). As explained by Twilight, Star Swirl the Bearded is the Father of the amniomorphic spell and also the most important conjurer of the pre-classical era in Equestria, creating more than 200 spells. He is also the mentor of Clover the Clever in the Hearth's Warming Eve play.

Sweet Berry is a second toyline pony first released in 1998. She's a warm, caring friend to everyone who knows her. She loves to give tea parties and pour beautiful rainbows from her teapot to make her friends smile. She then reappeared in the third incarnation toyline as Sweetberry, the owner of the Sweetberry Sweet Shoppe and starred in many of the 2000 animated My Little Pony cartoons and DVDs. Alongside Cotton Candy, Sweetberry works at the Cotton Candy Cafe, and they like to help each other out. She also likes to make sweet treats for her friends. Sweetberry is sometimes busy but very reliable.

He is sometimes seen wearing sunglasses and carrying a satchel over his neck. It is later revealed that he sleeps with a teddy bear. The Mane-iac is the primary villainess of the comic book. According to Spike the Dragon, a tragic accident caused her to fall into the vat. As a result, in her sick behavior, she plans to steal the magic orb in use to power up her gigantic hairdryer. Fortunately, Spike had her distracted by subduing all her hench colts and freeing Twilight Sparkle and all her best friends as the Power Ponies. In the end, as the Mane-iac's distraction sustains, she is subdued by her own hair which tickles her in bondage.

Fortunately, Spike had her distracted by subduing all her hench colts and freeing Twilight Sparkle and all her best friends as the Power Ponies. In the end, as the Mane-iac's distraction sustains, she is subdued by her own hair which tickles her in bondage.

My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic
Brian Drummond

Time Turner is an Earth pony with an hourglass cutie mark who appeared in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic. Hasbro acknowledged the character's popularity in the Comic Con 2011 promotional poster, where he is explicitly posed in a way that his cutie mark is clearly visible. Time Turner appears as one of the background characters of multiple episodes. His only speaking role as an Earth pony is when he rejects Apple Bloom's offer of buying apples in Call of the Cutie, and gets pressured into buying one in return for getting her to leave him alone. He was placed in the scene by storyboard artist Sabrina Alberghetti for his colors and design. He makes a somewhat prominent appearance in Green Isn't Your Color, carrying Photo Finish's palanquin together with Twilight Sky. In The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, he makes another somewhat prominent appearance where he is in charge of spinning the hourglass that starts the competition between the Flim Flam Brothers and the Apple family. During this scene he wears a green tie. He was intentionally placed into the scene by the storyboarding supervisor for the episode. Time Turner later appears a few times in Hearts and Hooves Day. He is seen running past Apple Bloom and Sweetie Belle while accidentally splashing mud on them in the musical sequence. He reappears in Apple Bloom's imagination while running around in a panic, as well as in three village shots, once standing next to an unknown stallion and twice standing next to Derpy on the bridge. He also appears in It's About Time, laughing at Twilight Sparkle's idea of time travel. His latest cameo was in A Canterlot Wedding Part 2, as he was seen running across the street from a changeling. His first official name is revealed in the upcoming My Little Pony Friendship is Magic Trading Card Set by Enterplay LLC, while his second name has been confirmed by Hasbro. His fan-name, Dr Whooves is a shout-out to his perceived resemblance to David Tennant's Tenth Doctor from the British Sci-Fi series Doctor Who.

Tink-a-Tink-a-Too was originally released in 2003 as part of the Rainbow Celebration Ponies assortment. She was released three times in the Donkey pose until in 2006 when she was later released in the Diva Pose. She later appeared in one of the 2000 animated specials, Pinkie Pie and the Ladybug Jamboree, as part of Pinkie Pie's musical band.

Toola-Roola has been first produced in 2005, in which she loved dressing up, until she again appeared in 2007 along with the other Core 7 members. She is a talented artist who loves to paint pictures and make arts and crafts. She always finds inspirations everywhere, even in the unusual spots. In "Twinkle Wish Adventure", it is revealed that she is afraid of the dark and, thus, would not sleep at night without a nightlight.

She then appeared again in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic, this time as a school age earth pony, also receiving a major design change. She is one of Apple Bloom's friends and is described to have a nerdy personality but is very generous and supportive. She also shows several stereotypically nerdy traits, such as a curly red mane and tail, pale coat, large, large glasses, and a nasal speech impediment (she has a hard time pronouncing W's and S's).
